## <span style="color: orange;"> **Hi!** </span>

I am a PhD Candidate at the [University of Frankfurt](https://www.fb03.uni-frankfurt.de/99347568/Welcome_to_the_Institute_of_Political_Science?locale=en), working out of [Peace Research Institute Frankfurt (PRIF)](https://www.hsfk.de/en)'s Berlin office, where I am currently the interim head.

I will be a Junior Visiting Scholar at [Nuffield College, Oxford](https://www.nuffield.ox.ac.uk/) from 10--12/2022 and was a Visiting Researcher at the [Global Governance Research Unit](https://www.wzb.eu/en/research/international-politics-and-law/global-governance) at WZB Berlin Social Science Center from 12/2021--03/2022.





## <span style="color: orange;">Research interests</span>

My primary research interest is **economic sanctions** and their domestic consequences in the targeted country. I examine the effect of sanctions imposition on human rights and democracy, as well as how the regime type and state capacity of the targeted government shape the effects of sanctions. I am also interested in the drivers of public support for sanctions and under which conditions the general public and decisionmakers are more or less likely to support using them. This and other work examines norms in international politics.

A second broad interest of mine is **empirical social science research design**. My dissertation is largely quantitative and uses matching techniques for causal inference using panel data. I also use survey experiments and unexpected events data. I am interested in tools for knowledge aggregation and cumulation in the social sciences, including replication, extension, and systematic reviews. I have also published detailed archival work with embargoed records, as well as comparative case studies.

## <span style="color: orange;">Other interests, projects, and media</span>

Outside of work, I enjoy road and trail running, collage, and watching baseball.

I occasionally offer scholarly opinions based on my research, including in [ZDF heute](https://www.zdf.de/nachrichten/politik/sanktionen-wirkung-konflikt-ukraine-russland-100.html), HR2 Kultur ([1](https://podcasts.apple.com/de/podcast/swift-die-finanzwaffe/id91697773?i=1000548503123), [2](https://podcasts.apple.com/de/podcast/er-hat-es-getan-putins-angriff-und-die-folgen/id91697773?i=1000552140321)), [HR Info](https://podcasts.apple.com/de/podcast/kampf-dem-schwarzmarkt-entwicklungsarbeit-gegen-den/id1542750625?i=1000520030876), [Frankfurter Neue Presse](https://www.fnp.de/frankfurt/frankfurter-konfliktforscher-es-wird-auch-uns-hart-treffen-91390165.html), and elsewhere.

A while back, I researched, visualized, and published data-driven journalism at [*Einfacher Dienst*](https://einfacherdienst.de/), mostly focusing on German domestic politics. Our results and work were featured in [FAZ](https://www.faz.net/aktuell/feuilleton/pop/warum-deutschsprachige-musik-ploetzlich-so-erfolgreich-ist-16126000.html), [taz](https://taz.de/Wie-die-AfD-mit-kritischen-Fragen-umgeht/!5527392/), [Deutschlandfunk Nova](https://www.deutschlandfunknova.de/beitrag/sachsen-kritik-der-berichterstattung-ueber-dresden-und-chemnitz), the [ZDF Heute-Show](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T-D6lN7F9io), and [VICE Germany](https://www.vice.com/de/article/bvg55v/die-partei-genossen-sollen-mitglieder-sexuell-belastigt-haben-sexismus-antidiskriminierung), among other outlets.

In the past, I have worked for or interned at the German Bundestag, Goethe-Institut Kigali (Rwanda), the Federal Statistical Office, and the Federal Institute for Population Research.
